intro: Dendrophthoe gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of specific host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from its host through specialized root structures called haustoria. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
